Package com.atakmap.android.dropdown

Class DropDownReceiver

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.content.BroadcastReceiver
      • com.atakmap.android.dropdown.DropDownReceiver
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractSheetDropDown, AttachmentBroadcastReceiver, BullseyeDropDownReceiver, CallForFireBroadcastReceiver, ChatManagerMapComponent.ChatDropDownReceiver, CompassOverlayReceiver, ContactDetailDropdown, ContactPresenceDropdown, CoTInfoBroadcastReceiver, CoTSelector, DangerCloseReceiver, DetailedModelViewerDropdownReceiver, DrawingToolsMapReceiver, DrawingToolsToolbar, DropDownNavigationStack, EmergencyTool, EnterLocationDropDownReceiver, EudApiDropDownReceiver, FeatureEditDropdownReceiver, FeaturesDetailsDropdownReceiver, HostileManagerDropDownReceiver, IconManagerDropdown, ImageDropDownReceiver, ImageGalleryReceiver, ImageMapReceiver, ImportManagerDropdown, JumpBridgeDropDownReceiver, LayersManagerBroadcastReceiver, MedicalLineBroadcastReceiver, ModelDetailsDropdownReceiver, NineLineBroadcastReceiver, RadioDropDownReceiver, RangeAndBearingCircleDropDown, RangeAndBearingDropDown, RecentlyAddedDropDownReceiver, ResectionDropDownReceiver, RouteElevationBroadcastReceiver, RouteMapReceiver.RouteDropDownReceiver, RouteToolbarBroadcastReceiver, RoverDropDownReceiver, SensorDetailsReceiver, ShapeMsdDropDownReceiver, SphereImageViewerDropDownReceiver, SpotMapReceiver, SSESlantDetailsView.SlantDropDownReceiver, TrackHistoryDropDown, VideoBrowserDropDownReceiver, VideoDropDownReceiver, ViewshedDropDownReceiver
    public abstract class DropDownReceiver
extends android.content.BroadcastReceiver

    • Method Detail

      • dispose

        public final void dispose()
        Perform any cleanup activity prior to destruction. The dropdown will no longer be usable after dispose is called.

        Subclasses will need to implement disposeImpl for any specific disposal steps.

        Note: The creator of the drop down is responsible for the disposal.

      • disposeImpl

        protected abstract void disposeImpl()
        Any drop down specific disposal implementation that is performed during the disposal of a drop down.

      • showDropDown

        public void showDropDown​(android.view.View contentView,
                         double lwFraction,
                         double lhFraction,
                         double pwFraction,
                         double phFraction,
                         com.atakmap.android.dropdown.DropDown.DropDownSide side,
                         boolean ignoreBackButton,
                         boolean switchable,
                         DropDown.OnStateListener stateListener)
        Display the view in a side pane. onDropDownVisible will not be called if the stateListener is registered.
        Parameters:
        contentView - view to display
        lwFraction - fraction of the screen width-wise the view should take in landscape mode.
        lhFraction - fraction of the screen height-wise the view should take in landscape mode.
        pwFraction - fraction of the screen width-wise the view should take in portrait mode.
        phFraction - fraction of the screen height-wise the view should take in portrait mode.
        side - side to display the panel on
        ignoreBackButton - if true, side pane will not close on back button pressed.
        switchable - if true, side pane can be switched from LEFT_SIDE to RIGHT_SIDE in the presence of drop down that will ignore the back button.
        stateListener - listens to drop down state changes.

      • showDropDown

        public void showDropDown​(androidx.fragment.app.Fragment fragment,
                         double lwFraction,
                         double lhFraction,
                         double pwFraction,
                         double phFraction)
        ignoreBackButton defaults to false.
        See Also:
        showDropDown(Fragment, double, double, double, double, boolean, boolean, OnStateListener)

      • showDropDown

        public void showDropDown​(androidx.fragment.app.Fragment fragment,
                         double lwFraction,
                         double lhFraction,
                         double pwFraction,
                         double phFraction,
                         boolean ignoreBackButton,
                         boolean switchable)
        ignoreBackButton defaults to false.

      • showDropDown

        public void showDropDown​(androidx.fragment.app.Fragment fragment,
                         double lwFraction,
                         double lhFraction,
                         double pwFraction,
                         double phFraction,
                         boolean ignoreBackButton,
                         boolean switchable,
                         DropDown.OnStateListener stateListener)
        Display the fragment in a side pane. onDropDownVisible will not be called if the stateListener is registered.
        Parameters:
        fragment - fragment to display.
        lwFraction - fraction of the screen width-wise the fragment should take in landscape mode.
        lhFraction - fraction of the screen height-wise the fragment should take in landscape mode.
        pwFraction - fraction of the screen width-wise the fragment should take in portrait mode.
        phFraction - fraction of the screen height-wise the fragment should take in portrait mode.
        ignoreBackButton - if true, side pane will not close on back button pressed.
        stateListener - listens to drop down state changes.

      • isRetained

        public boolean isRetained()
        Should this drop down be maintained on the stack. If it is not retained on the stack, then the next drop down that is opened will dismiss this drop down.

      • setRetain

        public void setRetain​(boolean retain)
        Should this drop down be maintained on the stack used in the case of nested drop downs. If the dropdown should not be maintained on the stack it will be removed when another drop down is opened.

      • setTransient

        public void setTransient​(boolean isTransient)
        Flags the drop-down as transient to handle a number of specific cases: - DropDownManager.getTopDropDownKey() ignores this drop-down - Opening this drop-down does not close other drop-downs (even with setRetain(boolean) set to false)
        Parameters:
        isTransient - True if this drop-down should be flagged as transient

      • isTransient

        public boolean isTransient()
        Check whether this drop-down is flagged as transient See setTransient(boolean) for more info
        Returns:
        True if this drop-down is flagged as transient

      • setAssociationKey

        public void setAssociationKey​(java.lang.String key)
        Sets the associated setting screen in the Tools section so if the settings screen is open while this drop down receiver is open and in the foreground, the associated setting screen will be opened.
        Parameters:
        key - Settings screen key

      • getAssociationKey

        public java.lang.String getAssociationKey()
        Get the associated settings screen key
        Returns:
        Settings screen key

      • onBackButtonPressed

        protected boolean onBackButtonPressed()
        For a dropdown that has told the drop down manager to ignore the back button. This method will be called in order to inform the dropdown that the back button has been pressed. If the drop down handled the back button, then return true else return false. If the method returns false, then the drop down will be closed on pressing the back button.

      • onStateRequested

        protected void onStateRequested​(int state)
        Signal for a request by the handle.
        Parameters:
        state - DROPDOWN_STATE_FULLSCREEN = 2; DROPDOWN_STATE_NORMAL = 1; DROPDOWN_STATE_NONE = 0;

      • dropDownAlreadyExists

        protected void dropDownAlreadyExists()
        Action to take when a dropdown is already open under the stack.

      • closeDropDown

        public final void closeDropDown()
        Close the drop down for this Receiver.

        protected void hideDropDown()

      • unhideDropDown

        protected void unhideDropDown()

        protected final boolean _showDropDown()

      • isVisible

        public final boolean isVisible()
        Check if the dropdown is showing.
        Returns:
        true if showing, false if otherwise.

      • isClosed

        public final boolean isClosed()
        Has the drop down been closed.

        Returns:
        current DropDown

      • getMapView

        public final MapView getMapView()
        The content view for a MapActivity.
        Returns:
        MapView

      • getBackStackCount

        public int getBackStackCount()
        Because there is only one backstack per application we need to keep track of the number each dropdown has.
        Returns:
        the number of items this dropdown has in the backstack.

      • isTablet

        public boolean isTablet()
        Returns true if the drop down receiver is being used on a tablet.
        Returns:
        true if it is a tablet.

      • isPortrait

        public boolean isPortrait()
        Returns true if the drop down receiver is being used in portrait mode.
        Returns:
        true if it is in portrait mode.

      • resize

        protected void resize​(double widthFraction,
                      double heightFraction)
        Resize the dropdown and open the side pane to fit.
        Parameters:
        widthFraction - fraction of the screen width-wise the view should take.
        heightFraction - fraction of the screen height-wise the view should take.

      • setSelected

        protected void setSelected​(MapItem m,
                           java.lang.String icon,
                           boolean closeOnDelete)
        In order to unify management of the concept of a selected icon within the system, this will manage the selection lifecycle in accordance with the same rules as a drop down. registration can occur after the drop down is showing. the selection icon will be shown when the drop down is visible the selection icon will be hidden when the drop down is not visible the selection will no longer be managed if the drop down is closed. if the drop down is opened again, a call to register selection must be made.
        Parameters:
        m - the point map item to use as the selected icon.
        icon - the location of the asset to use.
        closeOnDelete - Close the drop-down when the selected item is deleted

      • setSelected

        protected void setSelected​(MapItem m,
                           java.lang.String icon)
        Sets the icon to be used for the specified map item.
        Parameters:
        m - the map item to be selected.
        icon - the string for the icon to be used.

      • setSelected

        protected void setSelected​(MapItem item)
